Attention Food Pantry Families the Tiger Pride Food Pantry will be Open this Wednesday September 2nd instead of Thursday this week. The Pantry will be open from 2:45- 4:00pm this week only we will return to regular hours next Thursday September 10th from 2:45-4:45pm. Sorry for any inconvenience. If you have any questions please contact Mr.Maynard at the school or here on our Facebook page. Again the Pantry will be open this Coming Wednesday September 2nd from 2:45-4:00pm. Thank you

post_text:
New Boston Schools is planning meals for full time Remote Learning students for the upcoming school year. Delivery/Pickup locations will be 10:30 a.m. ‚Äì 11:00 a.m. in front of the school, 11:05 a.m. ‚Äì 11:35 a.m. ‚Äì New Boston Kiwani‚Äôs, and 11:40 a.m. ‚Äì 12:10 p.m. ‚Äì New Boston Commons. Pickup meals will be for 5 days, breakfast and lunch, and the delivery day is Friday. Please answer the 2 questions survey so that we can prepare. Please submit this survey by Monday, August 10th, at 8:00 a.m. if your kids are full time remote learning. Thank you.

https://forms.gle/ZSGYcw2xZq1pFjKe8

Full Time Bus Driver Position

New Boston Local Schools is seeking applications for a Full Time Bus Driver.
Must have or be willing to obtain a CDL School Bus Driver Endorsement.
If interested, please send a letter of interest to:
Melinda Burnside, Superintendent
#1 Glenwood Tiger Trail, New Boston, OH 45662
or email melinda.burnside@nbtigers.net
Deadline to apply is Wednesday, July 29th, 2020.

post_text: Scioto County Schools Teaching Staff: To take advantage of 37 FREE contact hours provided by the GRIT project, you MUST register by June 30th. Once you have registered, you will have until the end of August to complete the training. Your participation is critical in moving the project forward. For more information and to register, contact Tammy Hambrick at tammy.hambrick@scoesc.org or Sandy Mers at sandy.mers@scoesc.org.

post_text:
NEW BOSTON GRADUATION-May 15th

Due to possible inclement weather, the presentation of diplomas at Glenwood High School will be in the gymnasium. The graduate, one at a time, may bring 4 (four) people in the building with him/her. These are the only people allowed in the building at one time, per Governor DeWine‚Äôs orders. This means the school will be closed to the public. We will begin bringing the Class of 2020 in the gym at 6:00 p.m. and will concluded approximately 8:30 p.m.

We will be putting together a video with speeches, scholarship winners, receiving of diplomas, etc. and will be ready for release as soon as we can get it compiled. This evening, the presentation of diplomas will be live streamed and if you would like to watch. There will be a link for you to click on New Boston Local School‚Äôs Facebook page
text:
NEW BOSTON GRADUATION-May 15th

Due to possible inclement weather, the presentation of diplomas at Glenwood High School will be in the gymnasium. The graduate, one at a time, may bring 4 (four) people in the building with him/her. These are the only people allowed in the building at one time, per Governor DeWine‚Äôs orders. This means the school will be closed to the public. We will begin bringing the Class of 2020 in the gym at 6:00 p.m. and will concluded approximately 8:30 p.m.

We will be putting together a video with speeches, scholarship winners, receiving of diplomas, etc. and will be ready for release as soon as we can get it compiled. This evening, the presentation of diplomas will be live streamed and if you would like to watch. There will be a link for you to click on New Boston Local School‚Äôs Facebook page

post_text: We will be having a socially distant graduation ceremony on May 15, 2020 at the stadium beginning at 6pm or in the Glenwood gym if there are weather issues. Attached is the process to be followed during this unique graduation ceremony. We are attempting to have the safest and best graduation ceremony possible while honoring Governor DeWine's directives.

post_text:
RE: Tiger Pride Food Pantry:

Starting Tuesday March 17th the food pantry will be open From 12pm to 2pm on Tuesdays and Fridays for the next three weeks to ensure our students and immediate families are taken care of. In addition, the food pantry will be giving out Power Packs to the students that received them on a weekly basis. Also, if you cannot make it to one of the open pantry days, on Wednesday‚Äôs, Anthony Maynard will be scheduling delivery drop off to people that cannot make it. You can message Mr Maynard on the Tiger Pride Food Pantry Facebook page if you have any more questions or concerns.
text:
RE: Tiger Pride Food Pantry:

Starting Tuesday March 17th the food pantry will be open From 12pm to 2pm on Tuesdays and Fridays for the next three weeks to ensure our students and immediate families are taken care of. In addition, the food pantry will be giving out Power Packs to the students that received them on a weekly basis. Also, if you cannot make it to one of the open pantry days, on Wednesday‚Äôs, Anthony Maynard will be scheduling delivery drop off to people that cannot make it. You can message Mr Maynard on the Tiger Pride Food Pantry Facebook page if you have any more questions or concerns.

post_text:
The Southeast District Athletic Board has gone to all online sales for boys‚Äô and girls‚Äô basketball presale tickets at the sectional and district tournaments. The Board reduced the price of the presale ticket by $1.00 to help offset the fees associated with online ticket purchasing. Tickets purchased at the gate will remain $5.00 for sectional and $6.00 for district tournament games.

The link to purchase online tickets is https://ohsaa.org/tickets.

Purchasers may choose the game they wish to attend and designate their support. Upon the conclusion of the game, the purchasers of tickets for the winning team will automatically receive an email with details to purchase tickets for the next‚Ä¶

October 9, 2019 at 7:35 PM ¬∑

We are proudly supporting the Glenwood High School Quiz Bowl Team on our billboard spot this week. Check out the billboard going 52 East at the New Boston Walmart. We invite you to like and share this post and show your Tiger Pride!

The New Boston Local School District is seeking qualified substitute aides, nurses and teachers. Click on the links below for more information on the requirements and how to sign up as a substitute.

- Substitute Aides
http://www.scoesc.k12.oh.us/SubstituteAides.aspx

- Substitute Nurses http://www.scoesc.k12.oh.us/SubstituteSchoolNurses.aspx

- Substitute Teachers
http://www.scoesc.k12.oh.us/SubstituteTeachers1.aspx
